page.title: 12Farming
page.content: Arable farming, characteristic of much of East Anglia, is the major land use locally. We found crops of Wheat, Barley, Sugar Beet, and some potatoes. There is some stock farming, a herd of Fresians is kept at the farm opposite the school gates. Many fields of hay were seen on our walks, providing winter feed, and some for conversion into silage one clamp of which we saw near Taylor's Grove above the village. Many of the Meadows near the flood plain of the Black Bourn were used for this purpose. We were especially fascinated by a bailer which made large circular bales, as though it was laying an egg! Though a lot of hedges have disappeared fortunately a number of local farmers have retained theirs, giving a rich source of wildlife, noticeable on walks in the area.
